dialogue.speaker: Elderly Neighbor
dialogue.text: Your garden looks different this year. More... alive somehow.

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: I stopped trying to control it. Started listening instead.

dialogue.speaker: Elderly Neighbor
dialogue.text: Ah, you've learned the secret. Gardens teach us who's really in charge.

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: Every plant knows exactly what it needs. I just had to stop thinking I knew better.

dialogue.speaker: Elderly Neighbor
dialogue.text: Takes some folks a lifetime to learn that. How did you figure it out?

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: I had a good teacher. They showed me that wisdom is just another word for paying attention.

actions.action: tends plants with reverent attention, hands in soil like prayer
flourishes in organized chaos, each plant finding its perfect place
leans on fence, recognizing a fellow student of the earth
work their ancient patterns, weaving sound into the morning

environment.description: Backyard garden in full summer glory, domestic space transformed into wisdom classroom
environment.mood: earthed enlightenment, practical mysticism, connection through soil
